comments.body:
It looks weird. Can we use the while loop? 
```bash
START="$(date +"%s")"
TIMEOUT=5

while [[ "$(date +"%s")" -lt "$((START + TIMEOUT))" ]]; do
    date;
    sleep 1;
done
```
I would leave it as it is for now. It's quite more readable and does give a lot more (150*4 = ~600 s timeout + overhead).
